alert.note: Alert for Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 1:50AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The Gustavus Area. * WHEN...Until 700 PM AKDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 AM AKDT, Minor flooding is expected to begin Monday and last until shortly after rain lets up Tuesday afternoon. Additional rainfall of around 1 inch is expected at upper elevations through Tuesday afternoon. - Rink Creek Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - For Salmon River at Gustavus : At 1:15am the stage was 15.22 feet and steady. The river reached a crest around 15.4 feet around 11 pm monday. Flood Stage is 15.5 feet. Impacts: At 15.5 feet: Water will begin to flow over Wilson and Rink Creek roads and ditches will be full. Roads will be soft in places and travel across these areas will be difficult.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
